condition.description:
Most heart attacks happen when a clot in a coronary artery blocks the supply of blood and oxygen to your heart. If it's not treated quickly, a heart attack can cause heart muscle tissue to die, and can make it difficult for your heart to pump blood out to the rest of your body.

You can do your part to prevent a heart attack in the following ways:

  • Medications: If you're at risk of having a heart attack or if you've already had one, medications such as antihypertensives for blood pressure, statins for cholesterol, and blood thinners like aspirin can help your heart and blood vessels function better.
  • Lifestyle: Eat heart-healthy foods, exercise regularly, and get lifestyle conditions like diabetes under control.
  • Don't smoke. Cigarette smoking directly damages your heart and blood vessels.
indications: heart attack prevention in people with diabetes
recurrent heart attack prevention with high cholesterol
condition.name: Heart attack prevention
symptoms: Chest discomfort: Pressure, squeezing, or pain
Discomfort in the upper body: Arms, shoulders, neck, or back

indications: Recurrent heart attack prevention with high cholesterol
Heart attack prevention in people with diabetes

carousel_items: Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure and kidney function one week after starting or changing your dose of Perindopril.
Tell your doctor about any dizziness, cough, or throat irritation that doesn't go away.
Requires routine blood tests to check how your kidneys are working.
Don't take it if you're pregnant.

basics.benefits_moa: Perindopril is an angiotensin converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor. By blocking a chemical that usually tightens blood vessels, it makes blood vessels relax. This lowers blood pressure and allows more blood and oxygen to get to your heart and other organs.
basics.bottom_line: Perindopril is a good blood pressure-lowering medicine that protects kidney function.
downsides: Up to 1 in 10 people can get a dry cough with this class of medicine. It ranges from a mild tickle in the throat to a persistent hacking cough.
Requires a yearly blood test to see how the medicine is affecting your body.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.
Not always covered by insurance, so it can be expensive.

downsides_processed.orig: Up to 1 in 10 people can get a dry cough with this class of medicine. It ranges from a mild tickle in the throat to a persistent hacking cough.
Requires a yearly blood test to see how the medicine is affecting your body.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.
Not always covered by insurance, so it can be expensive.

upsides: A first-choice blood pressure treatment for many people.
Lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Protects kidney function, which is especially useful for people with diabetes or who have mild-to-moderate kidney disease.
Recommended for anyone with heart failure since it lowers the risk of death and further damage to your heart.

upsides_processed.orig: A first-choice blood pressure treatment for many people.
Lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Protects kidney function, which is especially useful for people with diabetes or who have mild-to-moderate kidney disease.
Recommended for anyone with heart failure since it lowers the risk of death and further damage to your heart.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Perindopril can cause birth defects. If you're pregnant or considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medicines.

description_processed.orig: Perindopril can cause birth defects. If you're pregnant or considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medicines.

risks_warnings.title: Cough
risks_warnings.description: Taking Perindopril may cause minor throat irritation or a dry cough. This can happen at any time while you're taking Perindopril. If the cough bothers you, talk to your doctor about other options.
risk_factors: History of ACE inhibitor induced cough

description_processed.orig: Taking Perindopril may cause minor throat irritation or a dry cough. This can happen at any time while you're taking Perindopril. If the cough bothers you, talk to your doctor about other options.

risks_warnings.title: Unusual tongue swelling
risks_warnings.description: Angioedema, or swelling in the face, lip, tongue, throat, or other organs, can happen at any time while you're taking Perindopril. Talk to a doctor or pharmacist if you have any head or neck swelling or abdominal pain that doesn't go away.

description_processed.orig: Angioedema, or swelling in the face, lip, tongue, throat, or other organs, can happen at any time while you're taking Perindopril. Talk to a doctor or pharmacist if you have any head or neck swelling or abdominal pain that doesn't go away.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems due to high potassium
risks_warnings.description: Perindopril can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and routine lab tests are needed to measure your potassium.

description_processed.orig: Perindopril can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and routine lab tests are needed to measure your potassium.

risks_warnings.title: Worsening kidney problems
risks_warnings.description: Perindopril has a risk of making your kidneys not work as well. It's important to get blood work done to check your kidney function before starting Perindopril and at least yearly after.

description_processed.orig: Perindopril has a risk of making your kidneys not work as well. It's important to get blood work done to check your kidney function before starting Perindopril and at least yearly after.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping

userStories.tip: I was prescribed too high of a dose. It caused serious throat tightening which made me cough. Switching to a low dose I've had no problems since.

carousel_items: Using low doses (81mg) of aspirin every day can lower your risk of heart attack and stroke, but it isn't good for everyone. Only take aspirin daily if your doctor recommends it.
Higher aspirin doses can be used to treat occasional pain, swelling, and fever. Using ibuprofen or acetaminophen (Tylenol) instead can lower your risk of serious bleeding.
Take with food to lower the chance of an upset stomach.
Don't use for kids younger than 18 years old.
Stop taking this right away and tell your doctor if you have ringing in your ears, unusual bleeding, or nausea or vomiting that doesn't go away.

clock.tip: Take with food or milk to lower stomach upset.

basics.benefits_moa: Aspirin is a salicylate and non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It blocks the inflammation process in your body, which relieves swelling and pain. It also prevents blood platelets from forming clots, which thins your blood.
basics.bottom_line: A low dose of Aspirin (81mg) every day can protect your heart, but it's not the best medicine to take for pain, swelling, or fever.
downsides: Not a preferred medication for treating pain, swelling, or fever due to its high risk of bleeding.
NSAIDs (like ibuprofen and naproxen) and acetaminophen (Tylenol) are better for treating pain and fever thank aspirin.
Aspirin raises your risk of bleeding, especially when used with other blood thinner medications like warfarin (Coumadin).
Studies show that using higher doses of Aspirin (162 mg or more) every day raises your risk of stomach bleeding and doesn't provide any additional heart protection.

downsides_processed.orig: Not a preferred medication for treating pain, swelling, or fever due to its high risk of bleeding.
NSAIDs (like ibuprofen and naproxen) and acetaminophen (Tylenol) are better for treating pain and fever thank aspirin.
Aspirin raises your risk of bleeding, especially when used with other blood thinner medications like warfarin (Coumadin).
Studies show that using higher doses of Aspirin (162 mg or more) every day raises your risk of stomach bleeding and doesn't provide any additional heart protection.

upsides: When taking low doses (81 mg) every day, aspirin provides protection for your heart and prevents heart attacks and stroke.
Used in higher doses to relieve pain, swelling, and fever.
Available over-the-counter in drugstores by itself and in combination with other cold and flu medications.

upsides_processed.orig: When taking low doses (81 mg) every day, aspirin provides protection for your heart and prevents heart attacks and stroke.
Used in higher doses to relieve pain, swelling, and fever.
Available over-the-counter in drugstores by itself and in combination with other cold and flu medications.

drugs.one_liner: Relieves pain, fever, and inflammation. Protects your heart and thins blood.

userStories.tip: research and understand the actual reason to take this medicine, as well as any medicine - than it will be helpful. Don't take it "just because". High quality Aspirin (e.g. Bayer) is much better (better effect without harming)

drugs.name: Aspirin

Blood clot prevention for artificial heart valve
Blood clot prevention for peripheral artery disease

Higher aspirin doses can be used to treat occasional pain, swelling, and fever. Using ibuprofen or acetaminophen (Tylenol) instead can lower your risk of serious bleeding.
Take with food to lower the chance of an upset stomach.
Don't use for kids younger than 18 years old.
Stop taking this right away and tell your doctor if you have ringing in your ears, unusual bleeding, or nausea or vomiting that doesn't go away.

risks_warnings.title: Brain damage or death from Reye's Syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Aspirin use is linked to a condition called Reye's syndrome that causes liver and brain swelling. This is rare but very serious. Let your doctor know about any nausea, vomiting, unusually low energy, or changes in behavior.

description_processed.orig: Aspirin use is linked to a condition called Reye's syndrome that causes liver and brain swelling. This is rare but very serious. Let your doctor know about any nausea, vomiting, unusually low energy, or changes in behavior.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Aspirin can cause serious problems including inflammation, bleeding, and ulcers in the stomach or intestines. The longer you take Aspirin, the higher the risk is. If you notice blood or a dark/black color in your stool, tell your doctor right away.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers
Taking aspirin, NSAIDs, or blood thinners
Drinking more than 3 alcoholic beverages a day

description_processed.orig: Aspirin can cause serious problems including inflammation, bleeding, and ulcers in the stomach or intestines. The longer you take Aspirin, the higher the risk is. If you notice blood or a dark/black color in your stool, tell your doctor right away.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Aspirin can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breathe or can cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. Get medical help immediately if you develop a skin rash, fever, swelling, or have trouble breathing.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Aspirin can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breathe or can cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. Get medical help immediately if you develop a skin rash, fever, swelling, or have trouble breathing.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to unborn babies
risks_warnings.description: Aspirin can cause birth defects. Don't use Aspirin while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Aspirin can cause birth defects. Don't use Aspirin while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

carousel_items: Rotate the spot where you inject Lovenox every day.
While on this, it can take longer to stop bleeding and you are more likely to bruise or bleed more easily.
Avoid taking certain anti-inflammatory drugs (like NSAIDs) because they can make you more likely to bleed.
Can cause swelling in your legs, diarrhea, and nausea.

basics.benefits_moa: Lovenox is an anticoagulant that prevents certain blood-clotting proteins from working. By stopping blood clots from forming, there's a lower chance of having a stroke or blood clots travel to your lungs.
basics.bottom_line: Lovenox is a good anticoagulant that reduces the risk of death or bleeding, and blood clots are less likely to happen. However, it is only available as an injection which isn't great if you're afraid of needles.
downsides: It is only available as an injection, so it's not great if you're afraid of needles.
While surprise bleeding episodes can be treated while taking Lovenox, they won't completely work.
It doesn't work as well as other medications for "thinning the blood" if you are overweight, underweight, or if you have kidney disease.

downsides_processed.orig: It is only available as an injection, so it's not great if you're afraid of needles.
While surprise bleeding episodes can be treated while taking Lovenox, they won't completely work.
It doesn't work as well as other medications for "thinning the blood" if you are overweight, underweight, or if you have kidney disease.

upsides: In a study that compared Lovenox to other medications used to stop blood clots, there was a lower risk of clots coming back, with similar rates of major bleeding and mortality.
You don't need to go in for lab tests to check whether it's working, unlike other medications like warfarin that require regular blood draws.
Available in generic so it can be cheaper than other "blood thinners".
Good option if you're pregnant or have cancer.

upsides_processed.orig: In a study that compared Lovenox to other medications used to stop blood clots, there was a lower risk of clots coming back, with similar rates of major bleeding and mortality.
You don't need to go in for lab tests to check whether it's working, unlike other medications like warfarin that require regular blood draws.
Available in generic so it can be cheaper than other "blood thinners".
Good option if you're pregnant or have cancer.

userStories.tip: Expensive, can cause bleeding (locally and remote)

drugs.name: Lovenox

labeled_indications.indication: DVT (blood clot) prevention after abdomen surgery
DVT (blood clot) prevention after knee surgery
DVT (blood clot) prevention after hip surgery

off-label_indications.indication: DVT (blood clot) prevention when starting warfarin (Coumadin)
DVT (blood clot) prevention after cancer surgery

carousel_items_processed.orig: Rotate the spot where you inject Lovenox every day.
While on this, it can take longer to stop bleeding and you are more likely to bruise or bleed more easily.
Avoid taking certain anti-inflammatory drugs (like NSAIDs) because they can make you more likely to bleed.
Can cause swelling in your legs, diarrhea, and nausea.

risks_warnings.title: Blood clot in the spine
risks_warnings.description: You're more likely to have a blood clot in the spine if you're taking Lovenox and are getting either a spinal tap or an epidural. Call your doctor immediately if you notice pain or a tingling or burning sensation, numbness, weakness, or inability to urinate.
risk_factors: Getting anesthesia in the spine (epidural anesthesia)
Taking NSAIDs or other blood thinning medicines

description_processed.orig: You're more likely to have a blood clot in the spine if you're taking Lovenox and are getting either a spinal tap or an epidural. Call your doctor immediately if you notice pain or a tingling or burning sensation, numbness, weakness, or inability to urinate.

risks_warnings.title: Unusual bleeding
risks_warnings.description: There are certain medicines that can significantly change the amount of Lovenox in your body, putting you at risk for bleeding or making the drug less effective. Let your doctor know about other prescription and non-prescription medicines you're taking, especially other medicines that affect bleeding risk like aspirin and NSAIDs.

description_processed.orig: There are certain medicines that can significantly change the amount of Lovenox in your body, putting you at risk for bleeding or making the drug less effective. Let your doctor know about other prescription and non-prescription medicines you're taking, especially other medicines that affect bleeding risk like aspirin and NSAIDs.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of stroke or increased risk of blood clots
risks_warnings.description: Don't stop taking Lovenox before your doctor tells you to. You could be at a higher risk for stroke or heart attack, especially if you have certain heart rate problems, like atrial fibrillation. Talk to your doctor if you're interested in stopping this medicine or switching to a different one.

description_processed.orig: Don't stop taking Lovenox before your doctor tells you to. You could be at a higher risk for stroke or heart attack, especially if you have certain heart rate problems, like atrial fibrillation. Talk to your doctor if you're interested in stopping this medicine or switching to a different one.

risks_warnings.title: Clotting problems
risks_warnings.description: Lovenox shouldn't be used in people who have a history of heparin-induced thrombocytopenia (HIT). HIT can happen when heparin is given to a person and their immune system creates antibodies that activate platelets, causing significant unexpected clotting. Laboratory tests can confirm this is happening and all heparin-related treatments need to be stopped immediately.

description_processed.orig: Lovenox shouldn't be used in people who have a history of heparin-induced thrombocytopenia (HIT). HIT can happen when heparin is given to a person and their immune system creates antibodies that activate platelets, causing significant unexpected clotting. Laboratory tests can confirm this is happening and all heparin-related treatments need to be stopped immediately.

basics.benefits_moa: Micardis is an angiotensin receptor blocker (ARB). By blocking a chemical that usually tightens blood vessels, it makes blood vessels relax. This lowers blood pressure and allows more blood and oxygen to get to your heart and other organs.
basics.bottom_line: Micardis is a good blood pressure-lowering medicine that protects kidney function just like ACE inhibitors, but has fewer side effects.
downsides: Requires a yearly blood test to see how the medicine is affecting your body.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.
Not always covered by insurance, so it can be expensive.

downsides_processed.orig: Requires a yearly blood test to see how the medicine is affecting your body.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.
Not always covered by insurance, so it can be expensive.

upsides: Lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Works similar to ACE inhibitors (like lisinopril), but doesn't have the same side effects like cough and swelling.
Protects kidney function, which is especially useful for people with diabetes or mild-to-moderate kidney disease.
Recommended for people with heart failure since it lowers the risk of death and further damage to your heart.

carousel_items: Thins your blood to prevent clots from forming or getting bigger. Doesn't break up existing clots.
The amount you need depends on your diet, other medical problems, and genes.
Take it exactly as instructed.
Can raise your risk of bleeding or bruising.
Requires regular blood tests to get your dose right.
Interacts with a lot of medicines and supplements. Don't start any new meds without talking to your doctor.
Eat foods containing consistent amounts of Vitamin K.
Tell your doctor immediately if you fell or if you have unusual bleeding, bruising, swelling, or changes in vision and coordination.
Get a medical bracelet so that people know you're on a blood thinner during an emergency situation.

basics.benefits_moa: Warfarin is an anticoagulant blood thinner. It lowers chemicals called clotting factors so that it's harder for your body to form blood clots.
basics.bottom_line: Warfarin is an old, cheap, and effective medicine to prevent blood clots, but it requires some monitoring, dose adjustments, and even lifestyle changes.
downsides: Raises your risk of bleeding and bruising.
Requires routine blood testing (called an INR) to see how well the medicine is working for you and to make the dose just right for you.
Many lifestyle factors can affect how well warfarin works, such as diet, alcohol, and activity level, so it's important that you try to stay consistent with your behaviors.
Lots of interactions with other drugs or supplements. Always check with your doctor or pharmacist before starting any new meds.

downsides_processed.orig: Raises your risk of bleeding and bruising.
Requires routine blood testing (called an INR) to see how well the medicine is working for you and to make the dose just right for you.
Many lifestyle factors can affect how well warfarin works, such as diet, alcohol, and activity level, so it's important that you try to stay consistent with your behaviors.
Lots of interactions with other drugs or supplements. Always check with your doctor or pharmacist before starting any new meds.

upsides: Oral blood-thinning medicine that prevents blood clots from forming or getting bigger.

Prevents complications of blood clots that can cause extreme discomfort or death. Examples include stroke (blood clots in the brain), pulmonary embolism (blood clots in the lungs causing trouble breathing), or deep vein thrombosis (blood clots in the legs causing pain and blood vessel damage).
Has an antidote, Vitamin K, in case of a major accidental bleeding.
Warfarin has been around for a long time, so we know a lot about how well it works and what the risks are.
It's dirt cheap.

upsides_processed.orig: Oral blood-thinning medicine that prevents blood clots from forming or getting bigger.

Prevents complications of blood clots that can cause extreme discomfort or death. Examples include stroke (blood clots in the brain), pulmonary embolism (blood clots in the lungs causing trouble breathing), or deep vein thrombosis (blood clots in the legs causing pain and blood vessel damage).
Has an antidote, Vitamin K, in case of a major accidental bleeding.
Warfarin has been around for a long time, so we know a lot about how well it works and what the risks are.
It's dirt cheap.

risks_warnings.title: Life threatening bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Warfarin is a blood thinner that makes it harder for your blood to clot. Your body may not be able to stop bleeds the way it normally does. Regular monitoring through blood tests, taking the exact amount as instructed, and having a consistent diet can lower your risk of bleeding. Let your doctor know about any persistent or frequent bleeding or bruising, pink urine, red or coffee-ground like stools. If you are bleeding a lot for more than 15 minutes, have a bruise that is getting bigger instead of better, or have fallen and hit your head, go get immediate medical help. In the hospital, doctors can give you a medicine that can reverse the effects of Warfarin.

description_processed.orig: Warfarin is a blood thinner that makes it harder for your blood to clot. Your body may not be able to stop bleeds the way it normally does. Regular monitoring through blood tests, taking the exact amount as instructed, and having a consistent diet can lower your risk of bleeding. Let your doctor know about any persistent or frequent bleeding or bruising, pink urine, red or coffee-ground like stools. If you are bleeding a lot for more than 15 minutes, have a bruise that is getting bigger instead of better, or have fallen and hit your head, go get immediate medical help. In the hospital, doctors can give you a medicine that can reverse the effects of Warfarin.

risks_warnings.title: Dying skin or tissue needing surgery or amputation
risks_warnings.description: Warfarin can cause this rare, but serious, condition where the skin or tissue is dying from poor blood flow. The risk is highest in the first few days to week 8 of starting Warfarin. Let your doctor know about any unusual changes in color of your extremities, breasts, or penis. Your doctor will then find you another blood-thinning medicine to replace Warfarin.

description_processed.orig: Warfarin can cause this rare, but serious, condition where the skin or tissue is dying from poor blood flow. The risk is highest in the first few days to week 8 of starting Warfarin. Let your doctor know about any unusual changes in color of your extremities, breasts, or penis. Your doctor will then find you another blood-thinning medicine to replace Warfarin.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Warfarin causes birth defects. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Warfarin causes birth defects. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

carousel_items: Take it at bedtime with a low-fat snack.
Avoid alcohol, spicy foods, and hot beverages right before you take this medicine.
Can cause flushing.
Call your doctor if you develop muscle pain.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.

basics.benefits_moa: niacin is a cholesterol-lowering medicine. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it seems to lower the amount of "bad" cholesterol (LDL) made by the liver. It may also help your body process cholesterol.
basics.bottom_line: niacin is good for lowering triglycerides (fats), but it's not as good as statins for improving cholesterol.
downsides: By itself, niacin is not as effective as statins for improving cholesterol.
Can cause flushing and stomach pain or discomfort.
You have to take it before bedtime with a low-fat snack.
If you don't take it regularly, you might have to re-start the medicine at a lower dose.

downsides_processed.orig: By itself, niacin is not as effective as statins for improving cholesterol.
Can cause flushing and stomach pain or discomfort.
You have to take it before bedtime with a low-fat snack.
If you don't take it regularly, you might have to re-start the medicine at a lower dose.

upsides: Lowers "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and raises "good" cholesterol (HDL) in people who have trouble doing this through diet and exercise.
Lowers the risk of a second heart attack.
Good for lowering triglycerides (fats).

upsides_processed.orig: Lowers "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and raises "good" cholesterol (HDL) in people who have trouble doing this through diet and exercise.
Lowers the risk of a second heart attack.
Good for lowering triglycerides (fats).

drugs.name: Niaspan

labeled_indications.indication: Recurrent heart attack prevention with high cholesterol

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take it at bedtime with a low-fat snack.
Avoid alcohol, spicy foods, and hot beverages right before you take this medicine.
Can cause flushing.
Call your doctor if you develop muscle pain.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.

risks_warnings.title: Muscle pain
risks_warnings.description: People on Niacin while taking statins have reported muscle pain which may lead to muscle and kidney damage. This has been very rare. Talk to your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain or weakness or fever and you don't know why.

description_processed.orig: People on Niacin while taking statins have reported muscle pain which may lead to muscle and kidney damage. This has been very rare. Talk to your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain or weakness or fever and you don't know why.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: People who take Niacin have reported liver damage, especially if taken with statins or if you drink large amounts of alcohol. This has been rare. Talk to your doctor if you've ever had liver disease as they may discuss alternatives, or they may monitor your liver with blood tests.

description_processed.orig: People who take Niacin have reported liver damage, especially if taken with statins or if you drink large amounts of alcohol. This has been rare. Talk to your doctor if you've ever had liver disease as they may discuss alternatives, or they may monitor your liver with blood tests.

risks_warnings.title: High blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: People with diabetes may have increases in their blood sugar levels while taking Niacin, especially during the first few months of taking this medication. Your doctor will work closely with you to see if changes to your diabetes medications are needed.

description_processed.orig: People with diabetes may have increases in their blood sugar levels while taking Niacin, especially during the first few months of taking this medication. Your doctor will work closely with you to see if changes to your diabetes medications are needed.

risks_warnings.title: Low platelets
risks_warnings.description: People on anticoagulants while on Niacin may have decreases in their platelet counts on blood tests. Tell your doctor if you are on anticoagulants, as they may have to monitor your blood and adjust your medications.

description_processed.orig: People on anticoagulants while on Niacin may have decreases in their platelet counts on blood tests. Tell your doctor if you are on anticoagulants, as they may have to monitor your blood and adjust your medications.

carousel_items: Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure and kidney function one week after starting or changing your dose of Perindopril.
Tell your doctor about any dizziness, cough, or throat irritation that doesn't go away.
Requires routine blood tests to check how your kidneys are working.
Don't take it if you're pregnant.

basics.benefits_moa: Perindopril is an angiotensin converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor. By blocking a chemical that usually tightens blood vessels, it makes blood vessels relax. This lowers blood pressure and allows more blood and oxygen to get to your heart and other organs.
basics.bottom_line: Perindopril is a good blood pressure-lowering medicine that protects kidney function.
downsides: Up to 1 in 10 people can get a dry cough with this class of medicine. It ranges from a mild tickle in the throat to a persistent hacking cough.
Requires a yearly blood test to see how the medicine is affecting your body.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.
Not always covered by insurance, so it can be expensive.

downsides_processed.orig: Up to 1 in 10 people can get a dry cough with this class of medicine. It ranges from a mild tickle in the throat to a persistent hacking cough.
Requires a yearly blood test to see how the medicine is affecting your body.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.
Not always covered by insurance, so it can be expensive.

upsides: A first-choice blood pressure treatment for many people.
Lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Protects kidney function, which is especially useful for people with diabetes or who have mild-to-moderate kidney disease.
Recommended for anyone with heart failure since it lowers the risk of death and further damage to your heart.

upsides_processed.orig: A first-choice blood pressure treatment for many people.
Lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Protects kidney function, which is especially useful for people with diabetes or who have mild-to-moderate kidney disease.
Recommended for anyone with heart failure since it lowers the risk of death and further damage to your heart.

drugs.name: Aceon

off-label_indications.indication: Heart attack prevention in people with diabetes

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure and kidney function one week after starting or changing your dose of Perindopril.
Tell your doctor about any dizziness, cough, or throat irritation that doesn't go away.
Requires routine blood tests to check how your kidneys are working.
Don't take it if you're pregnant.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Perindopril can cause birth defects. If you're pregnant or considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medicines.

description_processed.orig: Perindopril can cause birth defects. If you're pregnant or considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medicines.

risks_warnings.title: Cough
risks_warnings.description: Taking Perindopril may cause minor throat irritation or a dry cough. This can happen at any time while you're taking Perindopril. If the cough bothers you, talk to your doctor about other options.
risk_factors: History of ACE inhibitor induced cough

description_processed.orig: Taking Perindopril may cause minor throat irritation or a dry cough. This can happen at any time while you're taking Perindopril. If the cough bothers you, talk to your doctor about other options.

risks_warnings.title: Unusual tongue swelling
risks_warnings.description: Angioedema, or swelling in the face, lip, tongue, throat, or other organs, can happen at any time while you're taking Perindopril. Talk to a doctor or pharmacist if you have any head or neck swelling or abdominal pain that doesn't go away.

description_processed.orig: Angioedema, or swelling in the face, lip, tongue, throat, or other organs, can happen at any time while you're taking Perindopril. Talk to a doctor or pharmacist if you have any head or neck swelling or abdominal pain that doesn't go away.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems due to high potassium
risks_warnings.description: Perindopril can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and routine lab tests are needed to measure your potassium.

description_processed.orig: Perindopril can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and routine lab tests are needed to measure your potassium.

risks_warnings.title: Worsening kidney problems
risks_warnings.description: Perindopril has a risk of making your kidneys not work as well. It's important to get blood work done to check your kidney function before starting Perindopril and at least yearly after.

description_processed.orig: Perindopril has a risk of making your kidneys not work as well. It's important to get blood work done to check your kidney function before starting Perindopril and at least yearly after.

carousel_items: Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure one week after starting this medication, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Requires routine blood tests to check how your kidneys are working.
Don't take if you are pregnant.

basics.benefits_moa: Ramipril is an angiotensin converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor. By blocking a chemical that usually tightens blood vessels, it makes blood vessels relax. This lowers blood pressure and allows more blood and oxygen to get to your heart and other organs.
basics.bottom_line: Ramipril is a good blood pressure-lowering medicine that protects kidney function. Easy to use if you can't swallow whole capsules.
downsides: Up to 1 and 10 people can get a dry cough with this medicine. It ranges from a mild tickle in the throat to a persistent hacking cough.
Requires a yearly blood test to see how the medicine is affecting your body.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

downsides_processed.orig: Up to 1 and 10 people can get a dry cough with this medicine. It ranges from a mild tickle in the throat to a persistent hacking cough.
Requires a yearly blood test to see how the medicine is affecting your body.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

upsides: A first-choice blood pressure treatment for many people.
Lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Protects kidney function, which is especially useful for people with diabetes or mild-to-moderate kidney disease.
Recommended for anyone with heart failure since it lowers the risk of death and further damage to your heart.
The only ACE inhibitor that comes in a capsule that you can sprinkle in applesauce or water.

userStories.tip: Took the smallest dose and still lost normal voice strength. It Discouraged me from any public speaking or sustained conversations. Quit after 10 yrs.of use & full voice returned!

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping

userStories.tip: I was prescribed too high of a dose. It caused serious throat tightening which made me cough. Switching to a low dose I've had no problems since.
